error.signature: Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: require() of ES Module not supported.

verdict.summary: A CJS project is trying to require() a dependency that has migrated to ESM-only. Solutions: use dynamic import(), pin the last CJS version, or migrate the project to ESM.

dead_ends.action: Adding type: module to package.json without updating require() calls
dead_ends.why_fails: Setting type: module makes ALL .js files in the project ESM. Every require() call breaks with 'require is not defined in ES module scope'. This requires a full codebase migration, not a one-line config change.
dead_ends.common_misconception: type: module is a simple toggle that enables ESM support without affecting existing code.

dead_ends.action: Using dynamic import() synchronously in CJS code
dead_ends.why_fails: import() returns a Promise and is always asynchronous. It cannot be used as a drop-in replacement for synchronous require(). Code that depends on the module being available synchronously must be restructured to use async/await.
dead_ends.common_misconception: import() can be used synchronously like require().

dead_ends.action: Transpiling the ESM dependency back to CJS with babel
dead_ends.why_fails: Transpiling node_modules is fragile, slow, and may break the dependency's internal ESM imports. Most bundlers exclude node_modules by default for good reason.
dead_ends.common_misconception: Transpilation can undo a dependency's ESM migration.

workarounds.action: Use dynamic import() with await in an async context
workarounds.how: Replace const pkg = require('pkg') with const { default: pkg } = await import('pkg'). In CJS top-level code, wrap in async IIFE: (async () => { const pkg = await import('pkg'); })(); Note: import() returns a module namespace object.
workarounds.tradeoff: Dynamic import is async; requires restructuring synchronous code paths

workarounds.action: Pin the last CJS version of the dependency
workarounds.how: Check the dependency's changelog for the last version before ESM migration. Common examples: chalk@4, got@11, node-fetch@2, ora@5, execa@5, globby@11, p-limit@3. Pin with: npm install pkg@version --save-exact.
workarounds.tradeoff: Stuck on an older version; may miss security patches and features

workarounds.action: Migrate the entire project to ESM
workarounds.how: Set type: module in package.json. Replace all require() with import. Replace __dirname with import.meta.dirname (Node 21.2+) or fileURLToPath(import.meta.url). Replace module.exports with export default. Update jest/test config for ESM.
workarounds.tradeoff: Full project migration; may break other CJS-only dependencies in the chain

leads_to.condition: Converting to ESM causes syntax errors in CJS files
ESM conversion changes module resolution rules

preceded_by.condition: Module resolution led to discovering ESM/CJS mismatch

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ERR_REQUIRE_ESM means the module exists but is ESM-only and cannot be loaded via require(). ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND means the module does not exist at the resolved path.
